Reviews.Title: “Hostel Airone”
Reviews.Author: S H
Reviews.Content: we had a very terrible experience staying in this hotel.Staff was not friendly and wanted us to sign all the papers without reading with a comment that we are the only one who refuse to sign in the box saying that we will be send all sort of advertisement. Room did not feel clean, TV had one picture but the talks were from different channels. No soap, no shampoo. Breakfast area had a strange smell and the best was...that cleaning lady was also serving the breakfast...stay away from this hostel. Agree the price was good, but for 2 stars you would expext a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvy R
Reviews.Content: The room that was given was big enough for two people. Bathroom was spacious and clean, always warm water. Our towels were changed every day. This hotel is very centrally located in front of the train station gacing the Grand Canal. I found it a notexpensive hotel and goodvalue for money

Reviews.Title: “Two anatidaephobics in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Duz Nt M
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. The hotel is conveniently located, being only 2 Minutes walking distance from the Vaporetto Station Ferrovia (or Piazza le Roma). The staff were very helpful and the room was nicely decorated and warm. The only negative points were that we were charged 2â‚¬ tourist charge extra per night per person and that the bathroom could have been cleaner. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lenny p
Reviews.Content: I love Venice!!! This small hotel is close to the train station. Great position for seeing all the attactions by foot or by waterbus ( nearest station " Piazzale Roma"). Our room wasn't large, but it was clean and pretty. The typical continental breakfast was basic but enought for us. It was not a buffet breakfast. Staff was costreus andefficient. This Hotel is excellent value for money and I will recomend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Bare minimum HOSTEL, small and not clean”
Reviews.Author: ycheng421
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with private bath at the Hotel Airone based on the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. However, we were greatly disappointed. First, we had to check in at the hotel (I think it's called Hotel Grand Canal, it has a red awning) a few doors down. Then we had to go back to the Airone, which is a second story floor with no elevators. My friend and I each had luggage and it was quite difficult to carrying 40lb luggage each up a flight of stairs. The room was small and did not feel very clean. My pet peeve is that the private bathroom that we paid extra for had the toilet and shower head placed on a platform together. A toilet and shower together? Really? It was disgusting having to shower with the toilet a foot away from you. Hotel Airone is actually a hostel and although it was cheap, I would've paid the extra cost for a better room. There was not hot water at times and they don't have any amenities: no shower cap or hand soap and we had to go to the lobby of the Hotel Grand Canal to ask for a hair dryer. Definitely stay away from Airone and don't let the other positive reviews fool you. I know Venice can be expensive but this "hotel" was really beyond ridiculous. The only positive thing about it is that it's close to the Ferrovia station and a quick walk from the train station. However, since all the sights are by San Marco, it's still a 30-40minute vaporetto ride. Save your time and money and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks...”
Reviews.Author: Jay T
Reviews.Content: I slept in hotel airone in room 22â€¦ The room was simple but clean and in order and we had a wonderful view over the grand canalâ€¦.it was fantastic to wake up in the morning and see all the vaporetto, gondolas, boat going up and down on the river

Reviews.Title: “If you are on a budget in Venice....”
Reviews.Author: j3dnight
Reviews.Content: than this is a good spot for you. It's a short walk across the bridge and you are there facing the railroad station across the canal. The room was clean, small bathroom but we expected that. The double-bed was comfy but the two-twin ones sunk down when you laid on them so I'd recommend some new mattresses. It was tarzan hot when we were there and something happened with the a/c, it blew out air but not cool air, I should have called the front desk and didn't so my fault there, that was uncomfortable but for the price we paid and location I could definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place where you have all the facilities close to you , very close to main center but at a convenient price Hotel airone is your choice. We were in room 12, and we booked a room with shared bathroom. We were positively surprised because the shared bathroom was always clean and in order and we had also clean towels in the room. Even more we had all the means of transport close by!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jacky L
Reviews.Content: We had a double roomon the 1st floor facing the canal. It was small but clean and nice. The bed was confortable. Breakfast (typical continental breakfast) was juice bread crojssants coffee and milk ( not buffett). Staff very nice and funny! The rate was very reasonable for a two stars hotel in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nightmare!!! would not recommend at all! Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: Arthur M
Reviews.Content: We knew by the price that it would not be luxury. We got there at 10pm as our flight was delayed, nobody was there at reception so we had to go to the next door hotel to collect our room key. When we got to the room, we were welcomed with two single beds head to toes when out booking was for a double room. Also, a condom was left on the table waiting to be used! As this is not what we had booked we went back to the receptionist who was very unhelpful and would not change our room. We had to leave and find another hotel. The following morning, we went back to the hotel to speak to the manager who would not reimburse us and assure to us that a double room also means (two single beds ---- Why giving the option of the two on the website) ... As we did not want this to bother our short stay in Venice, we stayed with the other hotel and made a formal complaint back home to the internet travel agent (would recommend to copy the Venice police and Venice tourism offices on the email). We got the money back in the end.... A peace of advise, Venice is expensive but DO spend the extra â‚¬20 a night ...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Francescabarnes
Reviews.Content: Was completely worrying on the way to venice about the hotel because of everything I have read. I was worrying for no reason. We had a double room with shared facilities, we had a great time. Everyone in the hotel was respectful when using shared facilities and breakfast was basic but fine. Like everything in this hotel was basic but fine. You do have to check in and out at hotel canal, the staff there were very pleasant. I think I agree with past comments of it does feel more like a hostel especially if you have shared facilities so perhaps it should advertise as such and it might have more positive comments. A few things about Venice, myself and my husband wanted a gondola ride and the man at the gondola stop just near the hotel tried to ask us for 150 euro so we carried on walking for a while and we found an 80 euro trip that was perfect. The water buses can be pricey too about 7 euro a single trip but if you don't mind a little walking from the hotel to saint marks square took us 20 minutes max, simply take a right out of the hotel and the first or second right and walk straight and you soon pick up sign s.marco & Rialto which if you follow these you will be in the middle of the action in no time. We never used a water bus as we saw a lot more of venice walking, we passed a great fresh produce Market following the signs to the main s.marco area.

Reviews.Title: “Ok , great position ...”
Reviews.Author: manrobe
Reviews.Content: We take this hotel for a two days before our final destination. The position of the hotel is maybe the best in Venice, just across the terminal. We have no luck when taking the room because our agency reserved the room without bathroom in room. We have a shared bathroom what is not so great. Airone have 4 rooms with bathroom and a great view but the agency MUST search for that. For the hygiene of the hotel room is ok and the service is fine. The biggest problem that we seen in Airone is room without the bathroom (no privacy) and thin walls. The couple near us have a wild nights (we hear everything :(( ) . Take this hotel but ask for rooms with bathroom only !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and in front of the Gran Canal!”
Reviews.Author: paola186338
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good position,quiet, only 2 minutes walking from Piazzale Roma ( airport connections) and the railway station. Directy in front of the Gran Canal,beautiful! Room clean andvery confortable. Receptionist freindly, perfect to stay fews days in Vecice, good price.

Reviews.Title: “It was great :D”
Reviews.Author: BluePrint290
Reviews.Content: We didn't expected to find such a great room , after we read all the reviews on TripAdvisor.The room and the bathroom were very clean. Our room had it's own bathroom,and we even had breakfast included.The staff was friendly,the price for the room was excellent,and we had a great time !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: aigorsquinto
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. We really enjoyed staying at Hotel Airone.The hotel was very clean. Our room was small, but adequate. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is OK !!!”
Reviews.Author: Alyce69
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean and nice hotel, friendly staff. Not expensive ( only 40 euros per night!)

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feeling”
Reviews.Author: psoni
Reviews.Content: Great location. We took a train from Florence to Venice. And this is right across Venice train station across grand canal. The rooms are basic. No wifi. The breakfast and internet - super expensive. Even after paying hefty price for internet, you get 30 year old PC which is absolutely unpleasant to work with. The hotel doesn't have its own office. Rather the business is taken care by next door hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good value for euro (considering this is Venice)”
Reviews.Author: NormsWife
Reviews.Content: The location in Santa Croce could not be better. You can walk from the Treviso Airport bus or from the Santa Lucia train station in 5-10 minutes. There are decent restaurants and gift shops, and a great value leather shop on the same "block". You are less than 5 minutes walk to the vaporetto stop. However..... you have to check in and get all hotel services at a hotel a few doors down; Airone has no such services. That said, the desk help there was excellent. It is a long climb up rickety steps to get to your room. The bathroom is very small and lacking some things you'd expect, like facecloths. It is definitely not luxurious, but it is reasonably clean. If you want a budget (by Venetian standards) hotel, this is the place to go. If I had budgeted more money, I would like to have stayed somewhere nicer. But I was able to buy some nice bags with what I saved staying at the Airone!

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL IS TOTAL CRAP”
Reviews.Author: bumbletwitch
Reviews.Content: I am writing this having just come back from 3 days in Venice which i have to say has been unbelievable. The city is truly beautiful and if you have the right person to go with will give you enough memories to last a life time. However there are a few bad points. Firstly this has got to be one of the most expensive cities ever, 9 euro for a cup of tea, 4 euro a slice of Pizza, 4.5 euro half a beer so watch the pennies! Couple of hints are DONT eat around Rialto or St Marks go to Ferravia where prices are much better, Watch the cover charge at restaurants, in some it is 5 euro which adds up. Get a ACTV pass for the Vaporetto well worth it and go on a Traghetto Not a Gondolar, same boat but one costs between 80-300 euro and the other 50 cent! Okay time for the really bad point. Whatever you do DO NOT stay at the Hotel Airone on santa croce. This is a supposedly 2 star HOTEL but has to be worst hotel i have ever stayed in, and that includes North Africa! The photos on their website are complete rubbish, i attach mine which are genuine. They have no reception, you press a buzzer and then are given directions to another hotel down the street where you pick up a key and they ask you to pre pay, DONT DO IT, pay on leaving. You the go back to original door , open it and are met by the sight of mouldy torn carpet on stairs that are falling apart with great chunks of plaster split and falling off the wall! At the top of the stairs is what used to be a reception but is now used as an open storage facility for laundry....classy eh? Your room is best described as a shoe box except that shoe boxes do not have bare wires dangling in them and wall paper falling off the walls. Bathroom is a sliding door and you get a squirty hand wash with 4 towels. Double bed is 2 singles pushed together and i was lucky as got extra ( see photo of dead fly in bed!) Complained on first day in the evening but all of a sudden Bloke couldnâ€™t speak English and said come back next day. When we eventually got to reception and complained they took 24 euro off per day but still charged 80 per day. I would not stay there if you paid me 80 euro per day. DO NOT stay at this hotel under any circumstances as is a total dump and will spoil your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Airone, Venice - Bad Choice!”
Reviews.Author: AngelineB1
Reviews.Content: I returned recently from Venice and had booked this hotel after reading it is near the train station and that the staff are quite polite and helpful. That's about the only thing good about it! The photos online may look nice but then reality hits you - BIG TIME! The first impression was already bad. I had to check in at another hotel and was given a key to a small door into the Airone. There was nothing apart from a long, narrow, smelly, mouldy staircase up to the rooms. The carpeted flooring needs serious replacement. Some parts of the hotel is used for storage so it felt like you have just moved into a make-shift room doubling up for storage of laundry and junk. Suffered a few bites too - probably from the bed-bugs that others have written about. The price they charged is not justified at all. It should be classified 0-star. I had two nights there and couldnt wait to get out. Sad to say, it left me with a very poor first impression of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks in the bed. That should be enough to deter you.”
Reviews.Author: raidertraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Airone seemed clean enough on the surface. It smelled like antiseptic and everything appeared fine on the surface. However, when we woke up the next morning, my husband noticed something crawling in the bed. It was a tick! We pulled back the comforter and found three more of them! The person working the desk didn't speak English very well, so we decided to forget about it and get the heck out of there. We chose this hotel because of the price and location. I'm sure there are other hotels in the area that don't have blood sucking insects in the bed. Don't stay here. It's not worth it. Besides, they didn't even have bathrooms in the rooms. We had to walk down the hall to take a shower, just like we did when we were freshmen in college. They didn't offer breakfast, either, not that we would have eaten the food after finding bugs in the bed. Shop around. There are lots of other places in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: darkstar92234
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worse hotel I have ever stayed at, please listen to me and the other reviews and do not stay here!! My girlfriend and I booked this hotel through expedia and figured it would be a good place to stay due to the location, but this was by far the crappiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The room was extremely dirty, and the staff were clueless to everything we asked about. When the people in the room next to us walked around it made terribly loud noises in our room which woke us up at all times of the night. The beds were horrible, and at least 20 years old, there are much better 2 star cheaper hotels around, its sad after walking around a beautiful city all day, your dread going back to your hotel room! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A good option to visit Venice.”
Reviews.Author: MissLibelula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Airone Hotel the last days of December 2009. This hotel is a good option if you arrive by train as the hotel is in front of the train station and by bus as the drop off point of the bus from the airports is 100 m away in Piazzale Roma. To check in you have to go to the hotel Canal and they will give you the keys of your room and of the front door of the hotel. The room was alright (all depends on the price you pay), though the bathroom was very small. The central heating was fine and the room was clean. It is true that the matresses were not very confortable. Breakfast is not included, which it is a pity as it would give an extra point to this hotel. The main attractions are at a walking distance, though there is also the posibility to take a 'vaporetto' not far away from the hotel. In general a good option to stay in Venice, if you get a good price and the aim is to enjoy the attractions. Advice: Always take a map of Venice with you, it is very easy to get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: ryun
Reviews.Content: I was moved to Hotel Airone due to water leak at Hotel Canal. The room had mold on the walls in the bathroom and the bed mattress was worn out with bed bugs. I would have expected a reduced room rate for staying there. I would not recommend anyone stays here and if Hotel Canal has problems with a water leak, find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: louisecross
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Airone based on price and location and were pleased with our choice, our room was clean and the shared bathroom was clean. The reception staff at the hotel a couple of doors away who manage the Airone were very helpful and friendly, they have a good map of Venice that's worth having too. They also allowed us to leave our luggage there after checkout and offered a toilet for us to use if we needed it on our departure day. Our room looked out on the Grand Canal which was a thrill for us. There's a little restaurant nearby which has nice food. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on it. The hotel is located nearly opposite the train station and not far from the bus station. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: changsu
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is attractive. The service lady in the hotel is very unfriendly. The room is dirty. Do not book the room with shared shower.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alisonharris123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Airone on the last leg of our trip and after a terrible hotel in Florence, we were pleasantly surprised! I've read many bad reviews about this hotel and had preconceptions before arrival. Truthfully it is basic but it definatly did the job for three days. The rooms were made up beautifully each day, there was a new- looking air conditioning system, tv, comfy bed and sink. Some rooms had thier own bathroom but we shared between several other rooms, no problems there! The layout of the hotel may seem a bit strange at first as the rooms surround the dining area, from what I could tell the hotel is on one level. Breakfast was served between 8-10 am. There is no check in at Airone, 'Hotel Canal' roughly 20 metres away will check you in. Location is great, down the stairs of the hotel and your on the grand canal! Perfect for us as we caught the train, the station is opposite over the canal! I'd recommend any day but not for the image concious.

Reviews.Title: “I Agree With The Last Statement Do Not Go There”
Reviews.Author: roxyadventure
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed internet sited offered a room with a view. So when they arrived they enquired about this and told there was no such thing, when it was obvious there were windows looking onto the canal. With no shower near to their room, they had to wash in the sink. And to top it all off a staff member refused to give them their breakfast or a refund for the breakfast they had paid for as their flight was an early morning one. With Ryan Air, which was then cancelled, another business I would not recommend. Venice itself was brillant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: sandigirl
Reviews.Content: At 120Euros per night for a single ensuite room this has to be good value. I chose the Airone because the location is excellent, situated a 4 minute walk from the Piazzale Roma bus station. The thought of dragging suitcases up and down bridges and getting lost was a bit too much to cope with until I felt I'd found my bearings. My room overlooked the Gran Canal - a big bonus. The bed linen was very clean, but the downside is that it was a bit shabby and the bathroom needed updating. In the 3 days I was there I never saw another soul. The reception is at another hotel a few yards away. Next time I will book well in advance and go to La Calcina on the Zattere.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Airone
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 557, 30135 Venice, Italy
